specifiedDeploymentName.helpText: Deployment to release the update to

description.helpText: Description of the changes made to the app in this release

disabled.helpText: Specifies whether this release should be immediately downloadable

mandatory.helpText: Specifies whether this release should be considered mandatory

privateKeyPath.helpText: Specifies the location of a RSA private key to sign the release with.[33mNOTICE:[39m use it for react native applications only, client SDK on other platforms will be ignoring signature verification for now!

disableDuplicateReleaseError.helpText: When this flag is set, releasing a package that is identical to the latest release will produce a warning instead of an error

specifiedRollout.helpText: Percentage of users this release should be available to

bundleName.helpText: Name of the generated JS bundle file. If unspecified, the standard bundle name will be used 'index.electron.bundle'

development.helpText: Specifies whether to generate a Development or Production build

config.helpText: Path to the webpack config file. If omitted, "webpack.config.js" will be used (if they exist)

entryFile.helpText: Path to the app's entry JavaScript file. If omitted, "index.<platform>.js" and then "index.js" will be used (if they exist)

sourcemapOutput.helpText: Filename (including path) for the sourcemap of the resulting bundle. If 'sourcemap-output' and 'sourcemap-output-dir' are omitted, a sourcemap will not be generated

sourcemapOutputDir.helpText: Path to directory where the sourcemap for the resulting bundle should be written. Name of sourcemap file will be generated automatically. This argument will be ignored if 'sourcemap-output' argument is provided. If 'sourcemap-output' and 'sourcemap-output-dir' are omitted, a sourcemap will not be generated

outputDir.helpText: Output path for the bundle and sourcemap. If omitted, a bundle and sourcemap will not be generated

specifiedTargetBinaryVersion.helpText: Semver expression that specifies the binary app version(s) this release is targeting (e.g. 1.1.0, ~1.2.3)

extraBundlerOptions.helpText: Option that gets passed to webpack bundler. Can be specified multiple times

helpText: Release a React Native update to an app deployment

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

specifiedDeploymentName.helpText: Deployment to release the update to

description.helpText: Description of the changes made to the app in this release

disabled.helpText: Specifies whether this release should be immediately downloadable

mandatory.helpText: Specifies whether this release should be considered mandatory

privateKeyPath.helpText: Specifies the location of a RSA private key to sign the release with.[33mNOTICE:[39m use it for react native applications only, client SDK on other platforms will be ignoring signature verification for now!

disableDuplicateReleaseError.helpText: When this flag is set, releasing a package that is identical to the latest release will produce a warning instead of an error

specifiedRollout.helpText: Percentage of users this release should be available to

bundleName.helpText: Name of the generated JS bundle file. If unspecified, the standard bundle name will be used, depending on the specified platform: "main.jsbundle" (iOS), "index.android.bundle" (Android) or "index.windows.bundle" (Windows)

development.helpText: Specifies whether to generate a dev or release build

entryFile.helpText: Path to the app's entry JavaScript file. If omitted, "index.<platform>.js" and then "index.js" will be used (if they exist)

gradleFile.helpText: Path to the gradle file which specifies the binary version you want to target this release at (android only)

plistFile.helpText: Path to the plist file which specifies the binary version you want to target this release at (iOS only)

plistFilePrefix.helpText: Prefix to append to the file name when attempting to find your app's Info.plist file (iOS only)

buildConfigurationName.helpText: Name of build configuration which specifies the binary version you want to target this release at. For example, "Debug" or "Release" (iOS only)

sourcemapOutput.helpText: Path to where the sourcemap for the resulting bundle should be written. If omitted, a sourcemap will not be generated

sourcemapOutputDir.helpText: Path to folder where the sourcemap for the resulting bundle should be written. Name of sourcemap file will be generated automatically. This argument will be ignored if "sourcemap-output" argument is provided. If omitted, a sourcemap will not be generated

outputDir.helpText: Path to where the bundle and sourcemap should be written. If omitted, a bundle and sourcemap will not be written

specifiedTargetBinaryVersion.helpText: Semver expression that specifies the binary app version(s) this release is targeting (e.g. 1.1.0, ~1.2.3)

extraBundlerOptions.helpText: Option that gets passed to react-native bundler. Can be specified multiple times

extraHermesFlags.helpText: Flag that gets passed to Hermes, JavaScript to bytecode compiler. Can be specified multiple times

helpText:
Creates an artifacts directory with Calabash tests.

- Ruby 
- Gem xamarin-test-cloud

artifactsDir.helpText: Path to the artifacts directory to create

include.helpText: Additional files and directories to include. The value must be either path relative to the input directory, or be in format "targetDir=sourceDir"

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

projectDir.helpText: Path to the Calabash workspace directory (usually <project>/features)

signInfo.helpText: Use Signing Info for signing the test server

testApkPath.helpText: Path to the *.apk file with the Espresso tests. If not set, build-dir is used to discover it

helpText:
Creates an artifacts directory with Xamarin UI Tests.
Required external tools:
- .NET Framework on Windows, Mono Runtime on OS X
- NuGet package Xamarin.UITests, version 2.0.1 or higher

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

artifactsDir.helpText: Path to the artifacts directory to create

include.helpText: Additional files and directories to include. The value must be either path relative to the input directory, or be in format "targetDir=sourceDir"

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

buildDir.helpText: Path to the directory with the built test assemblies (usually <project>/bin/<configuration>)

storePassword.helpText: Password to the keystore. Corresponds to the "-storepass" argument in jarsigner

keyAlias.helpText: Alias to the key in the keystore. Corresponds to the "-alias" argument in jarsigner

keyPassword.helpText: Password to the matching private key in the keystore. Corresponds to the "-keypass" argument in jarsigner

signInfo.helpText: Use Signing Info for signing the test server.

uiTestToolsDir.helpText: Path to the directory containing the Xamarin UI Tests tools including test-cloud.exe

fixture.helpText: NUnit fixture / namespace to run. If used with include- / exclude-category the fixture filter is applied first (Can be used multiple times)

includeCategory.helpText: NUnit category to run. (Can be used multiple times)

excludeCategory.helpText: NUnit category to not run. (Can be used multiple times) (When include and/or fixture are combined with exclude, all tests with the included categories are run, except for those also marked with the excluded categories)

testChunk.helpText: Run tests in parallel by method

fixtureChunk.helpText: Run tests in parallel by fixture, ignore the use of include- / exclude-category

include.helpText: Attribute is not supported for XCUITest

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

buildDir.helpText: Path to the build output directory (usually <project>/Build/Products/Debug-iphoneos)

testIpaPath.helpText: Path to the *.ipa file with the XCUITest tests

helpText: Starts a test run with Appium tests.

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

dSymDir.helpText: Path to the directory with iOS symbol files. This option is deprecated and ignored

locale.helpText: The system locale for the test run. For example, en_US

language.helpText: Override the language (iOS only) for the test run

include.helpText: Additional files and directories to include. The value must be either path relative to the input directory, or be in format "targetDir=sourceDir"

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

async.helpText: Exit the command when tests are uploaded, without waiting for test results

timeoutSec.helpText: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for test results

vstsIdVariable.helpText: Outputs the Test Run Id to the named VSTS variable

testOutputDir.helpText: Path to the directory for test results. This parameter won't work when you run using --async because we have to wait for test results. The results will be saved in the working directory if a relative path is specified

buildDir.helpText: Path to the directory with the Appium tests (usually <project>/target/upload)

mergeJUnitXml.helpText: Merge the xml files into the <arg> file. Requires --test-output-dir to specify the directory where the <arg> file will be. This parameter is ignored when used with the --async option because we have to wait for test results.

dSymDir.helpText: Path to the directory with iOS symbol files. This option is deprecated and ignored

locale.helpText: The system locale for the test run. For example, en_US

language.helpText: Override the language (iOS only) for the test run

include.helpText: Attribute is not supported for Espresso

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

async.helpText: Exit the command when tests are uploaded, without waiting for test results

timeoutSec.helpText: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for test results

vstsIdVariable.helpText: Outputs the Test Run Id to the named VSTS variable

buildDir.helpText: Path to the Espresso output directory (usually <project>/build/outputs/apk)

testApkPath.helpText: Path to the *.apk file with the Espresso tests. If not set, build-dir is used to discover it

helpText: Starts a test run with previously prepared artifacts.

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

dSymDir.helpText: Path to the directory with iOS symbol files. This option is deprecated and ignored

locale.helpText: The system locale for the test run. For example, en_US

language.helpText: Override the language (iOS only) for the test run

include.helpText: Additional files and directories to include. The value must be either path relative to the input directory, or be in format "targetDir=sourceDir"

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

async.helpText: Exit the command when tests are uploaded, without waiting for test results

timeoutSec.helpText: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for test results

vstsIdVariable.helpText: Outputs the Test Run Id to the named VSTS variable

testOutputDir.helpText: Path to the directory for test results. This parameter won't work when you run using --async because we have to wait for test results. The results will be saved in the working directory if a relative path is specified

outputXmlName.helpText: Name of the merged XML file

helpText:
Starts a test run with Xamarin UI Tests.
Required external tools:
- .NET Framework on Windows, Mono Runtime on OS X
- NuGet package Xamarin.UITests, version 2.0.1 or higher

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

dSymDir.helpText: Path to the directory with iOS symbol files. This option is deprecated and ignored

locale.helpText: The system locale for the test run. For example, en_US

language.helpText: Override the language (iOS only) for the test run

include.helpText: Additional files and directories to include. The value must be either path relative to the input directory, or be in format "targetDir=sourceDir"

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

async.helpText: Exit the command when tests are uploaded, without waiting for test results

timeoutSec.helpText: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for test results

vstsIdVariable.helpText: Outputs the Test Run Id to the named VSTS variable

testOutputDir.helpText: Path to the directory for test results. This parameter won't work when you run using --async because we have to wait for test results. The results will be saved in the working directory if a relative path is specified

buildDir.helpText: Path to the directory with the built test assemblies (usually <project>/bin/<configuration>)

storePassword.helpText: Password to the keystore. Corresponds to the "-storepass" argument in jarsigner

keyAlias.helpText: Alias to the key in the keystore. Corresponds to the "-alias" argument in jarsigner

keyPassword.helpText: Password to the matching private key in the keystore. Corresponds to the "-keypass" argument in jarsigner

signInfo.helpText: Use Signing Info for signing the test server.

uiTestToolsDir.helpText: Path to the directory containing the Xamarin UI Tests tools including test-cloud.exe

fixture.helpText: NUnit fixture / namespace to run. If used with include- / exclude-category the fixture filter is applied first (Can be used multiple times)

includeCategory.helpText: NUnit category to run. (Can be used multiple times)

excludeCategory.helpText: NUnit category to not run. (Can be used multiple times) (When include and/or fixture are combined with exclude, all tests with the included categories are run, except for those also marked with the excluded categories)

mergeNUnitXml.helpText: Merge the xml files into the <arg> file. Requires --test-output-dir to specify the directory where the <arg> file will be. This parameter is ignored when used with the --async option because we have to wait for test results.

testChunk.helpText: Run tests in parallel by method

fixtureChunk.helpText: Run tests in parallel by fixture, ignore the use of include- / exclude-category

helpText: Starts a test run with XCUITest tests.

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

dSymDir.helpText: Path to the directory with iOS symbol files. This option is deprecated and ignored

locale.helpText: The system locale for the test run. For example, en_US

language.helpText: Override the language (iOS only) for the test run

include.helpText: Attribute is not supported for XCUITest

testParameters.helpText: Additional test parameters. The value must be in format "key=value"

async.helpText: Exit the command when tests are uploaded, without waiting for test results

timeoutSec.helpText: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for test results

vstsIdVariable.helpText: Outputs the Test Run Id to the named VSTS variable

buildDir.helpText: Path to the build output directory (usually <project>/Build/Products/Debug-iphoneos)

testIpaPath.helpText: Path to the *.ipa file with the XCUITest tests

helpText: Checks the status of the started test run.

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

testRunId.helpText: ID of the started test run

continuous.helpText: Continuously checks the test run status until it completes

helpText: Stop the started test run.

quiet.helpText: Auto-confirm any prompts without waiting for input

testRunId.helpText: ID of the started test run
